message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.RO, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with video deblurring, which is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. The proposed method uses bidirectional optical flows to handle locally varying and general blurs caused by various sources, such as camera shake, moving objects, and depth variation in a scene. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with optimization and efficient solvers, which are common topics in Graphics (cs.GR) and Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-categories. The paper also deals with handling dynamic scenes, which is a common topic in Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a single energy model that simultaneously estimates optical flows and latent frames, which is a common topic in Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category.
